African American Campaign

Be Active Your Way
Be Active Your Way

Overview
Overview

This lesson gives participants the specific details about and suggestions for obtaining the recommended levels of physical activity for good health
This lesson gives participants the
specific details about and suggestions
for obtaining the recommended levels
of physical activity for good health

Learning Objectives
Learning Objectives

• By the end of this presentation, participants
• By the end of this presentation, participants

should be able to: – Name at least 3 benefits of physical activity. – Recall the physical activity recommendations – Identify at least 3 ways to be physically active at home
should be able to:
– Name at least 3 benefits of physical activity.
– Recall the physical activity recommendations
– Identify at least 3 ways to be physically active at home

and work.
and work.

– Create a plan using the PA pyramid and Scoreboard – Understand how frequency, intensity, type and time
– Create a plan using the PA pyramid and Scoreboard
– Understand how frequency, intensity, type and time

formula help improve physical activity levels.
formula help improve physical activity levels.

Learning Objective 1
Learning Objective 1

• Name at least 3 benefits of physical activity
• Name at least 3 benefits of physical activity

– Gives you more energy – Helps you get and keep a healthy body weight – Lowers stress and helps you relax – Lowers risk of type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer
– Gives you more energy
– Helps you get and keep a healthy body weight
– Lowers stress and helps you relax
– Lowers risk of type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure,
heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer

– Strength training helps improve your posture
– Strength training helps improve your posture

Learning Objective 2
Learning Objective 2

• Recall the physical activity recommendations
• Recall the physical activity recommendations

– 30 minutes of moderate intensity physical activity every
– 30 minutes of moderate intensity physical activity every

day to reduce the risk of chronic disease
day to reduce the risk of chronic disease

– 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous physical activity to
– 60 minutes of moderate to vigorous physical activity to

keep your weight under control
keep your weight under control

– 60 to 90 minutes of moderate intensity physical activity
– 60 to 90 minutes of moderate intensity physical activity

to keep off the weight you’ve lost
to keep off the weight you’ve lost

– Children and teens need 60 minutes of moderate to
– Children and teens need 60 minutes of moderate to

vigorous intensity PA every day
vigorous intensity PA every day

Learning Objective 3
Learning Objective 3

Identify at least 3 ways to be physically active at home and work – Play with your kids – Dance at a quick pace – Work in the garden – Take PA breaks during meetings – Have walking meetings – Walk to work
Identify at least 3 ways to be physically active at
home and work
– Play with your kids
– Dance at a quick pace
– Work in the garden
– Take PA breaks during meetings
– Have walking meetings
– Walk to work

Learning Objective 4
Learning Objective 4

• Create a weekly physical activity plan using the
• Create a weekly physical activity plan using the

PA pyramid and Scoreboard – Choose a goal – Choose favorite types of physical activity – Chart your progress
PA pyramid and Scoreboard
– Choose a goal
– Choose favorite types of physical activity
– Chart your progress

Materials and Handouts
Materials and Handouts

• 5 Handouts
• 5 Handouts

o Recommended Minutes of Physical Activity for Adults
o Recommended Minutes of Physical Activity for Adults

o Health Benefits of Physical Activity (H-7) o Physical Activity Scoreboard (H-8) o Keeping FITT (H-26) o Physical Activity Pyramid (H-27)
